com.sterlingcommerce.security.dv

Class SCValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sterlingcommerce.security.dv.SCValidator

  • public class SCValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class which control data validation. The class provides mechanism to register validation rules for various types and then validate an input against those rules. The default constructor of the class is private and an instance of the class needs to be acquired. asmishra

      • addRuleRegistry

        public void addRuleRegistry(java.lang.String inputType,
                            ISCRuleRegistry registry)
        This method can be used to set an registry object ISCRuleRegistry for an input type.

        Registry is an object which holds rules for an input type. If for an input type, no registry object has been registered, default registry class SCDefaultRuleRegistry will be used.

        inputType input type for which registry should be used. registry rule registry

      • addRule

        public void addRule(ISCValidationRule rule,
                    java.lang.String inputType)
        Registers a validation rule for a given input type.

        If rule has ISCValidationRule#RULE_NAME_DEFAULT as name, rule will be added as default rule. And if rule has ISCValidationRule#RULE_NAME_GLOBAL as name, rule will be added as global rule.

        Methods #addGlobalRule(ISCValidationRule, String) and SCValidator#addDefaultRule(ISCValidationRule, String) can also be used to set global and default rules. rule validation rule inputType input type for which rule needs to be applied #addGlobalRule(ISCValidationRule, String) #addDefaultRule(ISCValidationRule, String)

      • addRule

        public void addRule(ISCValidationRuleKey key,
                    ISCValidationRule rule,
                    java.lang.String inputType)
        Registers a validation rule for a given input type. This rule would be retrievable with the similar key (equals and same hashCode) using #getRules(ISCValidationRuleKey, String) method. key corresponding key rule validation rule inputType input type for which rule needs to be applied

      • getRules

        public java.util.ArrayList<ISCValidationRule> getRules(java.lang.String name,
                                                       java.lang.String inputType)
        Returns registered rules for given input type.

        Note that this method returns rules registered for given name only. Default and global rules are not returned.

        This method never returns null. If no rules are found, empty array list is returned.

        name name of the rule inputType input type for which rule needs to be applied validation rules #getGlobalRules(String) #getDefaultRules(String)

      • getRules

        public java.util.ArrayList<ISCValidationRule> getRules(ISCValidationRuleKey key,
                                                       java.lang.String inputType)
        Returns rules registered with the similar key (equals and having same hashCode).

        This method never returns null. If no rules are found, empty array list is returned.

        key key to retrieve the rule inputType input type for which rule needs to be applied validation rules

      • getDefaultRules

        public java.util.ArrayList<ISCValidationRule> getDefaultRules(java.lang.String inputType)
        Returns default rules registered for given input type.

        This method never returns null. If no rules are found, empty array list is returned.

        inputType input type for which rule needs to be applied validation rules #getRules(String, String) #getGlobalRules(String)

      • getGlobalRules

        Returns global rules registered for given input type. '

        This method never returns null. If no rules are found, empty array list is returned.

      • getValid

        public java.lang.String getValid(java.lang.String context,
                                 java.lang.String input,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String inputType)
                          throws SCValidationException
        Validates given input against registered validation rules and returns validated value. Validation rules which are applied on the input are determined based on following rules -
        • If registered rules are found for given input name and input type, those rules along with global rules are used to validate the input.
        • If no registered rules are found for given input name and input type, global rules are used to validate the input.
        • If no global rules are found, default rules are used to validate the input.

        If an invalid input is encountered, an SCValidationException exception is thrown.

        context context for the input input input to be validated name name of the input inputType input type validated input SCValidationException validation exception is thrown if invalid input found #getValid(String, String, String, String, SCValidationContext) #getValid(String, String, String, String, SCValidationErrorList) #getValid(String, String, String, String, SCValidationErrorList, SCValidationContext)
        Throws:
        SCValidationException

        public java.lang.String getValid(java.lang.String context,
                                 java.lang.String input,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String inputType,
                                 SCValidationContext validationContext)
                          throws SCValidationException
        Validates given input against registered validation rules and returns validated value. Validation rules which are applied on the input are determined based on following rules -
        • If registered rules are found for given input name and input type, those rules along with global rules are used to validate the input.
        • If no registered rules are found for given input name and input type, global rules are used to validate the input.
        • If no global rules are found, default rules are used to validate the input.

        If an invalid input is encountered, an SCValidationException exception is thrown.

        context context for the input input input to be validated name name of the input inputType input type validationContext validation context. If null, default validation context will be used. validated input SCValidationException validation exception is thrown if invalid input found #getValid(String, String, String, String) #getValid(String, String, String, String, SCValidationErrorList) #getValid(String, String, String, String, SCValidationErrorList, SCValidationContext)

      • getValid

        public java.lang.String getValid(java.lang.String context,
                                 java.lang.String input,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String inputType,
                                 SCValidationErrorList errorList)
        Validates given input against registered validation rules and returns validated value. Validation rules which are applied on the input are determined based on following rules -
        • If registered rules are found for given input name and input type, those rules along with global rules are used to validate the input.
        • If no registered rules are found for given input name and input type, global rules are used to validate the input.
        • If no global rules are found, default rules are used to validate the input.

        If an invalid input is encountered, the SCValidationException is added to the passed error list. thrown.

        context context for the input input input to be validated name name of the input inputType input type errorList error list to which any exception needs to be added validated input #getValid(String, String, String, String) #getValid(String, String, String, String, SCValidationContext) #getValid(String, String, String, String, SCValidationErrorList, SCValidationContext)

        • If registered rules are found for given input name and input type, those rules along with global rules are used to validate the input.
        • If no registered rules are found for given input name and input type, global rules are used to validate the input.
        • If no global rules are found, default rules are used to validate the input.

        If an invalid input is encountered, the SCValidationException is added to the passed error list. thrown.

        context context for the input input input to be validated name name of the input inputType input type errorList error list to which any exception needs to be added validationContext validation context.       • removeRules

        public void removeRules(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String inputType)
        Removes all the rules registered with given name for given input type. This method does not remove global or default rules. name name of the rules which need to be removed inputType input type for which rules were registered

      • removeRules

        public void removeRules(ISCValidationRuleKey key,
                        java.lang.String inputType)
        Removes all the rules registered with given key for given input type. key key for the rules which need to be removed inputType input type for which rules were registered

      • setAllowOnlySingleRules

        public void setAllowOnlySingleRules(boolean b)
        If this method is called with true, the validator will keep ONLY LATEST rules per category for each input type. Categories are global, default, name, key. Which means once this method is called with true, the validator will remember only one rule per name, one rule per key and only rule as global and only one rule as default. Note: If you call this method with true argument, unwanted rules will be deleted and the process is irreversible.

        The same method can be called with false as parameter to allow multiple rules per category.

        b true to allow only one rule per category

      • isAllowOnlySingleRules

        public boolean isAllowOnlySingleRules()
        Returns true if allowSingleRules is set to true. true if allowSingleRules is set to true
